I just need a BLANK PAPER to DRAW and GUESS. NOT dancing little man. OK?

I am most certainly going to hell for what I've drawn in this game. 6.9/6.9 would draw again

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Perfect difficulty settings
+ Tests communication and teamwork
+ Workshops has new and exciting word categories 

[b]Cons[/b]
- Must be played with another person(s)
- No missions or objectives to fulfill
- Random generator frequently repeats words in the category

[b]Conclusion[/b]
I recommend this game to everyone! [i]Draw & Guess[/i] is a relaxing game that pushes you to communicate and work together to guess the word as fast as possible.

The new version is a very bad update, there is no longer the old version of the painting experience, I am very disappointed with the current version, and hope that the developers can immediately improve the game experience, the following are the problems I foundï¼š
1. In the public room, you can't start the game happily, because there are always people repeatedly entering and leaving the room, which makes it impossible to start the game, I think the game should cancel pushing room information when everyone is ready to start the game.
2. In the new version, if you choose the wrong lexicon or other settings, you can't go back to the waiting lobby in the game, which makes everyone annoyed.
3. In the game, when your brush draws to a location with UI, the brush can't draw properly. This is a bug in the new version, which will cause the full-screen landscape drawing to no longer draw better.
4. When someone quits during the game, the Tab's people list and the chat bar will be disabled to some extent.
5. In a normal 15s~300s painting game, the brush update is the most unreasonable, which is a very serious problem, because in a short painting time you don't have much time to adjust the value, this update is not even as good as the old version's 3 point value, which will make people feel stupid, I hope the developer can restore the old version's 3 fixed brush values in the next update again, or set it as an option that can Let the player choose the option.
6. In the painting game, the "point" and "short line" drawn by the brush is not very good, can be further optimized.
7. Flash animation will be played at the end of the game, which is more interesting than the old version, but you can't skip it, so it will seem a bit troublesome.
8. The tools used for drawing should not be limited to the mouse, in this update, if the tablet is connected after entering the game, the tablet will not work properly, which is not good for the game experience.

I hope this game can become better because it allows people to meet many friends and lose many friends.
Not really for english speaking players. You can't find anything but chinese lobbies. And if you want to play with your friends, everyone would have to buy it, unlike Jackbox games.

The game is not bad.But the server experience is quite terrible.

As a Chinese player,I don't think our players should take this for granted.I could have recommend this game to my friends and classmates.But I can't stand those network drops and Internet connection wrongs so frequently.It's hard for me to trust developers who claimed that they had already tried their best to work out these problems.Instead,it seems that they don't really care about players' experience and they are arrogant to us. (Some other foreign players may be included too.)

As far as I am concerned,I don't think hire a team to maintain your servers and gradually improve network connection quality is a puzzle that harder than Goldbach conjecture. After all it is not a intense battle game, a bit higher lag is acceptable.

Now, the only thing you need to do is arrange a server near Asia! It 'll benefit all the Asians and boost your sales as well.

"Draw & Guess" is a fun and engaging game that challenges players to express their creativity and imagination. In this game, players take turns drawing pictures based on a given prompt, while other players try to guess what the picture represents.

The game is easy to learn and can be played by people of all ages, making it an excellent choice for family game nights or social gatherings. The prompts range from simple words and phrases to more challenging concepts, allowing players to showcase their drawing skills and imagination.

One of the game's unique features is its online multiplayer mode, which enables players from all around the world to connect and play together. The game also provides a chat function, allowing players to communicate and share their thoughts and guesses, making it a great way to connect with others while having fun.

"Draw & Guess" is also highly customizable, allowing players to create their own custom prompts and play with friends using their own customized lists. This adds a personalized touch to the game, making it more engaging and enjoyable for players.

The game's graphics are simple yet charming, and the sound effects add an extra level of excitement and immersion. The game's user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate, making it a hassle-free experience for players.

Overall, "Draw & Guess" is an excellent game that combines creativity, imagination, and social interaction, making it a perfect choice for anyone looking for a fun and engaging experience. Whether you're playing with friends or strangers online, this game is sure to provide hours of entertainment and laughter.

It's just a very ordinary draw and guess game, nothing special. In the process of drawing, I found that drawing with the mouse is not particularly good-looking, but it is the only option. As a novice, after entering the room to play, I found that this game seems to be very unfriendly to newbies, because I didn't know how to play at first, I just drew a few times, and then I gradually understood the rules of the game. My only dissatisfaction is that as soon as I entered the game, I found that you only draw in simplified Chinese. I guess there is a room. I guess you draw in English. I guess there is no room. I always thought it was because my language was not set correctly, so I kept debugging the language. It was only later that I found out that there is really no room in English. I highly recommend this game, but I also wish there were more rooms in English and other languages to enrich the gameplay.

I've been playing Scribble It for a while and decided to give this a try. See if maybe there's something better out there ya know? Well this is not it! The features that this is missing (which Scribble It has) are some kind of single player mode, social features like avatars, a good selection of game modes, and most of all PEOPLE. I've tried 3x and there's never anyone hosting a game and when I hosted one for almost 10 minutes nobody joined. Scribble It has better features and a more active community. I'd say get that instead.

Suggestions to developers:

Sometimes I would like to draw adult content but I was worrying about there are people in this game cannot endure it. I hope each room can have a tag means adult content acceptable, and people need to enable a checkbox in their setting to  enter these rooms.

Players who quit in middle, AFK, or draw/guess wrong things intentionally needs to get some punishments .. I hope each player can have a behavior score to show in the room preparation view and we can vote to lower it. Then the host can determine if it should be kicked.

Also, I wish I can get player information in the middle of game, or having some game history. Sometimes I want to add steam friends but they just quit right after the showing section, and I was not able to find them anymore.

Game is good! Social based game needs good community environment. For me, these 3 ideas above is more important than other tech issues currently .. Hope you guys makes better games in the future!

I can totally understand the feeling of players who do not speak Chinese, I am here to explain why there are so many Chinese players which might also be a question that makes the developer confused, how the hell did so many Chinese players got to know this game? Just about 10 days ago, a video of this game became trending on a Chinese videos website called Bilibili, that's the reason why so many Chinese players are here.
  
I had a chance to play guessing English words with three guys from different countries, I guess two of them are from the middle east and the rest one is from Japan, a very fun experience and nice fellows. Drawing in this game is dope. You have a nice amount of options and 2 cool gamemodes. The problem lies in the playerbase. Almost no English speaking players. Most of the time I play with Chinese or Japanese people who speak English.
There is a Discord server for this game but the chances of finding someone there who is willing to play when you are is quite low I would say. 

If you like to draw with friends I hope they also have the game or are willing to buy otherwise don't bother for now. They can't join in if they don't have the game like in Drawful for example.

I wish this game had more English speaking players but as of right now it is very rare to find someone in the English server. I had to ask a guy in the Japanese server to switch to the English one so that I could understand what is being asked of me to draw. Developer says this might change once they release the game for mobile phones. I hope that will be the case.

I will change this review if the situation changes. Happy drawing.
